column4: hi, just did a apt-get dist-upgrade and it broke my nvida driver? I've tried to run the nvidia-installer script, just as before. But it wont work.  Anyone have a pointer for me, what im doing wrong?
probably your kernel got updated...you probably need a new driver downloaded
uname -r says the same as before. Its a kernel i compiled myself
oh, sorry...then I dont know...maybe so xorg-changes??
it was xorg.. or desktop chnges anyways.  but.. i just cant find what to do.
I am afraid I cant help that much as I am not using binary drivers so far
did you check of update made a new xorg.conf??
uuuhh...then I am really at my limits
and Nvidia script says it compiled and installed the driver correctly. but when i start x it says it cant find the module
just like xorg changed where it looks for modules in the update or something
:) its okay mate. i'll figure something out.  Or someone will :D
